metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2220 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the radius_get_vendor_attr function in the Radius extension before 1.2.7 for PHP allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a large Vendor Specific Attributes (VSA) length value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2220` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-radius-legacy - 1.2.5-2.4build1
php5-radius - 1.2.5-2.4build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php-radius package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.5-2.4build1').
